parameters.ticket_id: Replace with the actual ticket ID (integer)

body.content: This is a comment on the ticket. You can include detailed information about the issue or resolution.

request.curl_example:
curl -X POST \
  'https://your-domain.com/api/v1/tickets/123/comments' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer your_access_token' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "content": "This is a comment on the ticket. You can include detailed information about the issue or resolution.",
    "recipient_id": 2
  }'

body.content: This is a comment on the ticket. You can include detailed information about the issue or resolution.

notes: This endpoint allows you to create a new comment on a specific ticket.
The 'content' field is required and contains the text of your comment.
The 'recipient_id' field is optional and can be used to direct the comment to a specific user.
To add attachments to a comment, you can use the /api/v1/comments/{comment_id}/attachments endpoint after creating the comment.

multipart_form_data_example.description: If you want to upload attachments along with your comment, you can use multipart/form-data instead:
multipart_form_data_example.curl_example:
curl -X POST \
  'https://your-domain.com/api/v1/tickets/123/comments' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer your_access_token' \
  -H 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data' \
  -F 'content=This is a comment with an attachment.' \
  -F 'recipient_id=2' \
  -F 'attachments[]=@/path/to/your/file1.pdf' \
  -F 'attachments[]=@/path/to/your/file2.jpg'
